page.title: 01SOUTH WEST DARLINGTON
page.content:
Darlington developed into an industrial town based on railways during the 19th century. What is now the south west edge was owned by the influential Pease and Backhouse families. Their large country mansions are now mostly replaced by 20th century dwellings. These are the homes of the professional and middle classes in the main.
The south west of the town is mainly residential and divided by the main access road, the A66, into two parts. North of the A66 is a large area of private housing and to the south is a large council estate.
The approach to the town from the A66 is from the south, the A1(M) and Richmond or from the west and Barnard Castle via the A67.
